resources.string: Make the text on screen smaller or larger
1. Enter contact details of two persons whom you would like to notify in case of an emergency
2. Add an emergency (favourite) contact to whom you would like to make a call in case of an emergency
3. Shake your phone if you feel unsafe
4. The app will send notifications to all the three contacts containing a link to track the live location from where the phone has been shaked
5. The emergency (favourite) contact will receive a call along with the notification
This application has been developed by our group of 5 members:
under the mentorship of Palak Mantry, Hrushikesh Bhagwat and Saif Kazi who are 3rd year students from VJTI.
We are aspiring students of VJTI from the branches IT and EXTC, currently studying in 2nd and 3rd year.
Women Safety app is a small attempt from our side to make women feel safe wherever they are.
This project is part of Skill-Up - A platform organized by two coding committees of VJTI, Developer Student Clubs (DSC) and Community of Coders (COC).
We hope that this app will provide a user friendly experience and is able to fulfil all the requirements of the user.
Womenâ€™s safety has always been an issue of grave concern. This problem is compounded during travel, especially while travelling alone.
This app aims to be a one-stop solution for such safety concerns. It enables women to get urgent and timely help in case they are in danger
By sending notifications and calls just by shaking the phone, this app serves the purpose of helping women feel safe wherever they are.
An App developed for the safety of women
